intro: Straussia hillebrandii var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed straussia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its botanical features include a slender stem and small, inconspicuous fruits that mature into dry capsules. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
